greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n, k) = 2*n*k + n + k - 1.
comment: Rearrangement of A153238, numbers n such that 2*n+3 is not prime (we have 2*T(n,k) + 3 = (2*n+1)*(2*k+1), as 2*n+3 is odd it consists of (at least) two odd factors and all such factors appear by definition).
link: Mutsumi Suzuki Vincenzo Librandi's method for sequential primes (Librandi's description in Italian).
program: (MAGMA) [2*n*k+n+k-1: k in [1..n], n in [1..11]]; /* or, see example: */ [[2*n*k+n+k-1: k in [1..n]]: n in [1..9]]; // Bruno Berselli, Dec 04 2011
(Sage) flatten([[2*n*k+n+n-1 for k in (1..n)] for n in (1..12)]) # _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 01 2021
results.author: _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jan 06 2009
